Dimension is a way to describe how big or how many sides an object has. For example, a piece of paper has two dimensions ➖ it has a width and a length.
Re-read the story problem and pay special attention to the units of measurement it’s using (e.g. length, width, height). Make sure you know what each of these units means.
The height of an object is how tall it is when you stand it up. For example, the height of a book is how tall the book is when you stand it up on its spine.
